messages.text:
Hey guys,

I am happy to announce that I have just prepared the skeleton of the Julia package JMcDM which basically implements Saw, ARAS, NDS, Topsis, Electre, Dematel, Moora, Vikor, and AHP (Analytical hierarchy process) as multiple criteria decision making tools. The package also implements single criterion tools such as maximin, minimax, MLE, Savage, Laplace, and Expected Regret. A game solver is also implemented for zero sum games using JuMP and Cbc back-ends.

There is a list of unimplemented methods including PROMETHEE, MACBETH, COMET, etc. in the project repository.

I am planning to have a comprehensive tool for this subject and prepare the high quality documentation for developers. I am also planning to write a journal article, possibly for SoftwareX, of course with all of the developers and contributors.

So, this is an announcement and *an open invitation* for both package development and submitting a journal paper after it gets a mature level.

The repository is <https://github.com/jbytecode/JMcDM>

Thank you in advance!

I am happy to announce that I have just prepared the skeleton of the Julia package JMcDM which basically implements Saw, ARAS, NDS, Topsis, Electre, Dematel, Moora, Vikor, and AHP (Analytical hierarchy process) as multiple criteria decision making tools. The package also implements single criterion tools such as maximin, minimax, MLE, Savage, Laplace, and Expected Regret. A game solver is also implemented for zero sum games using JuMP and Cbc back-ends.

There is a list of unimplemented methods including PROMETHEE, MACBETH, COMET, etc. in the project repository.

I am planning to have a comprehensive tool for this subject and prepare the high quality documentation for developers. I am also planning to write a journal article, possibly for SoftwareX, of course with all of the developers and contributors.

So, this is an announcement and

messages.text:
Hi all, I am having trouble generating names for an empty DataFrame.  I need to generate them as follows:
```df = DataFrame()
names!(df, [Symbol(i) for i in 1.5:0.5:5])```
But this throws an error because the data frame doesn’t expect that many column names.  Does anyone know how to do this?  I don’t have to want to write
```df = DataFrame(1.5 = Float64[], 2.0 = Float64[], 2.5 = Float64[]) # etc.```
because that will take a long time…

elements.text: Hi all, I am having trouble generating names for an empty DataFrame.  I need to generate them as follows:

df = DataFrame()
names!(df, [Symbol(i) for i in 1.5:0.5:5])
But this throws an error because the data frame doesn’t expect that many column names.  Does anyone know how to do this?  I don’t have to want to write
df = DataFrame(1.5 = Float64[], 2.0 = Float64[], 2.5 = Float64[]) # etc.
because that will take a long time…

messages.text:
hello all, I believe there is a bug in 1.6 where `bytesavailable` always returns 0.  Has anyone run into this?  several of us started discussing it on zulip
```julia> open(io -> write(io, "what up"), "testfile.txt", "w+")
7

julia> f = open("testfile.txt")
IOStream(<file testfile.txt>)

julia> bytesavailable(f)
0

julia> readavailable(f)
7-element Vector{UInt8}:
 0x77
 0x68
 0x61
 0x74
 0x20
 0x75
 0x70```

messages.text:
Can I convert an Array with `Any` elements with something thats more concrete? I have code that looks like
```function run_sims(params) 
    nsims = 5
    sols = []
    for sim in 1:nsims       
        println("sim: $sim")   
        sample_params(params)
        push!(sols, _simulate(params))
    end
    return sols
end```
but the `typeof(sols)` says it's an array with element `Any`. The return object from `_simulate` is actually is known. It's an ODE Solution, but the type is quite long.
```julia> typeof(sol)
ODESolution{Float64,2,Array{Array{Float64,1},1},Nothing,Nothing,Array{Float64,1},Array{Array{Array{Float64,1},1},1},ODEProblem{Array{Float64,1},Tuple{Float64,Float64},true,ModelParameters,ODEFunction{true,typeof(aModel!),UniformScaling{Bool},Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing},Base.Iterators.Pairs{Union{},Union{},Tuple{},NamedTuple{(),Tuple{}}},DiffEqBase.StandardODEProblem},Rodas4{0,false,DefaultLinSolve,DataType},OrdinaryDiffEq.InterpolationData{ODEFunction{true,typeof(aModel!),UniformScaling{Bool},Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing},Array{Array{Float64,1},1},Array{Float64,1},Array{Array{Array{Float64,1},1},1},OrdinaryDiffEq.Rodas4Cache{Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,2},Array{Float64,2},OrdinaryDiffEq.RodasTableau{Float64,Float64},DiffEqBase.TimeGradientWrapper{ODEFunction{true,typeof(aModel!),UniformScaling{Bool},Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing},Array{Float64,1},ModelParameters},DiffEqBase.UJacobianWrapper{ODEFunction{true,typeof(aModel!),UniformScaling{Bool},Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing,Nothing},Float64,ModelParameters},DefaultLinSolve,FiniteDiff.JacobianCache{Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,1},UnitRange{Int64},Nothing,Val{:forward}(),Float64},FiniteDiff.GradientCache{Nothing,Array{Float64,1},Array{Float64,1},Float64,Val{:forward}(),Float64,Val{true}()}}},DiffEqBase.DEStats}```

```
function run_sims(params) 
    nsims = 5
    temp_sim = _simulate(params)
    sols = Array{typeof(temp_sim), 1}()
    for sim in 1:nsims       
        println("sim: $sim")   
        sample_params(params)
        push!(sols, _simulate(params))
    end
    return sols```
where I've run a single simulation before just to get the type

messages.text: There is also `return_type`
like `sols = Vector{Core.Compiler.return_type(_simulate, Tuple{typeof(params)})}()`

You can just do `identity.(xs)`
```julia> xs = Any[1, 2.0, 3]
3-element Vector{Any}:
 1
 2.0
 3

julia> identity.(xs)
3-element Vector{Real}:
 1
 2.0
 3 ```

messages.text:
MIT Press has just signed off on an agreement that allows us to post a PDF of our 2019 book "Algorithms for Optimization" online: <https://algorithmsbook.com/optimization>
(Not to be confused with our "Algorithms for Decision Making" book that we released last month at <https://algorithmsbook.com>. The print version will be available from MIT Press in 2022.)
All algorithms are implemented in Julia.

All algorithms are implemented in Julia.

messages.text:
Probably a basic question but I am from a stat (non CS) background trying to wrap my head around KD-Trees and I have the following:
``` 
 struct KdNode
     point::Tuple
     left::KdNode
     right::KdNode
     level::Int64
     KdNode() = (x=new();x.left=x;x.right=x)
 end

 KdNode((3,5,7),nothing,nothing,2) #error no method matching..
     ```
How do I initialize the first instance here in Julia? I tried stuff from <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/constructors/#Incomplete-Initialization> but I don't think I am doing it right.

but I don't think I am doing it right.

messages.text: I have an issue with using the up-arrow key to go back in the history in the REPL, that arrises after I’ve shelled out to a powershell script. If I do `run(`pwsh -NoProfile hellowold.ps1`)` , where `helloworld.ps1` simply is `Write-Host "Hello world"` , then subsequent scrolling through history fails. `run(`echo 123`)`  does not provoke this behavior. Should this be reported somewhere? I’m on OSX and Julia 1.6 rc1.

messages.text:
Anyone is familiar with JuMP? I couldn’t figure out the following error. I can read a .mps file using cplex. but couldn’t with JuMP. The code used to work fine.

*julia>* m = JuMP.read_from_file(“rootnodemodel.mps”)
*ERROR:* ROW name obj not recognised. Is it in the ROWS field?

messages.text: Running CI scripts on every pull request when the project contains the CI scripts themselves is considered harmful. <https://sprocketfox.io/xssfox/2021/01/18/pipeline/|https://sprocketfox.io/xssfox/2021/01/18/pipeline/>

attachments.title: Build Pipeline Security
attachments.text: Security concerns with PR build systems

elements.text: Running CI scripts on every pull request when the project contains the CI scripts themselves is considered harmful.

messages.text: Is there a Julia Stack Exchange? if not? why not? I use LaTeX a lot, and I love that within a quick search, I can find every answer to every question about LaTeX on the stack exchange. While this is a good place to congregate, I thought that a common place for Q's and A's to be addressed would be nice. Plus slack comments older than 10,000 recent posts requires a premium account, making it impossible for me to search if someone had the same question one month ago.

attachments.text: Hey all, we will be submitting our project application tonight (PST) for GSoC 2021. If you want to get involved as an admin or mentor, see here: Seeking Julia Mentors and Projects for GSoC 2021 and please get in touch asap!

messages.text: Good morning everyone! a newbie question, I need to search a text (MPS) file to find some key word to locate the section “RHS”; then check the next line to see if that line has the word “obj”. If there is, then remove that line and save the file. Since the file is large, e.g., 30 mb, what is the most efficient way to implement this task? Thanks!
